channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - World
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2018 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Stranded migrant ship reveals a fractured Europe
item.description: A rescue ship stranded in the Mediterranean Sea since Sunday is on its way to Spain, where the government has agreed to accept the 630 people on board.

item.title: 'Exhausted' migrants rescued from ship begin four-day journey to Spain
item.description: The search-and-rescue ship stranded in the Mediterranean Sea since Sunday began its roughly 800-mile journey to Spain on Tuesday evening after transferring more than 500 rescued migrants to Italian Coast Guard and naval ships.

item.title: US Navy rescues migrants at sea off the coast of Libya
item.description: A US Navy ship rescued 40 migrants off the coast of Libya Tuesday, according to US military officials.

item.title: Ways to help ongoing migrant crisis
item.description: So far this year more than 34,000 migrants and refugees have crossed the Mediterranean Sea seeking a new life. But more than 700 didn't make it, according to data from the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR).

item.title: Elon Musk's Boring Company set to build futuristic transport link in Chicago
Apple closes law enforcement loophole for the iPhone
Bitcoin prices have been manipulated, study says
With all the hacks, is investing in bitcoin safe?
Experts say this is the food of the future
They built a bridge that forever changed this village
She's empowering girls to pursue their dreams
item.description: Allison Williams introduces 2013 Top 10 CNN Hero Kakenya Ntaiya at "CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute."

item.title: He's 'Bridging the Gap' to a better world
item.description: Aaron Eckhart introduces 2010 Top 10 CNN Hero Harmon Parker at "CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute."

item.title: Goodbye, old iPhone: This could be 40X better
Bitcoin up 30,000X -- here's your backdoor in
$19.9 trillion idea hidden in plain sight

item.description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, attended a day of public engagements together in the county of Cheshire, England, on Thursday, June 14. It was the first such outing for the Queen and the Duchess since Meghan joined the royal family following her marriage to Prince Harry in May.
Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, stepped out with Britain's Queen Elizabeth II for her first official engagements without her husband Prince Harry by her side. CNN's Anna Stewart reports.
North Korea's state media airs the warm welcome the country's leader Kim Jong Un received upon his return to Pyongyang.
Ibrahim Manna, Managing Dir. of Careem, talks about how the company became the region's largest ride-hailing platform since launching in 2012 in Dubai.

North Korea state media aired a 42-minute long video showing behind-the-scenes footage of President Trump and Kim Jong Un's unprecedented trip, including a moment showing Trump saluting a North Korean general.

item.title: Einstein travel diaries reveal racist streak
item.description: Travel logs written by famed physicist and anti-racism campaigner Albert Einstein reveal that the scientist held some racist and xenophobic views.
The Ugandan government has embarked on a round of infrastructure projects to smooth the country's poor road networks.

It's been one year since the devastating fire that engulfed Grenfell Tower and claimed 72 lives in West London. CNN's Nick Glass pays tribute to the victims with traumatic testimonies from bereaved friends and family.
A woman is murdered in El Salvador every 19 hours, CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports on gang violence in the country.

CNN's John Vause speaks to the founder of Destiny Pictures, an independent production company in Hollywood, who says that he and his company were not involved in creating the video President Trump showed Kim Jong Un in Singapore, despite being credited.
The Japanese government enacted a bill lowering the age of adulthood from 20 to 18, but the legal age of drinking will stay fixed at 20.

item.title: Solstice Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts on the solstice.
The CEO of Plexus Group, Nick Earlam, talks about the company's decision to expand from a cotton trader to a sustainable cotton supply from seed development to end product.
The high demand for charcoal in Kenya is leading to major issues like deforestation, and now companies are finding ways to use it sustainably.
